name: Hotel d'Orsay - Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Hotel d'Orsay many times, going back to when it was the smaller, more modest Hotel Solferino. The location could not be better - a block from the Seine; a block from Musee d'Orsay - metro stations 2 minutes away. Plus the footbridge into the Tuilleries. Small rooms are small but manageable; larger ones are spacious. Staff is outstanding and offers excellent, personalized, bilingual service. A single computer terminal in the lobby offers free internet access.
reviews.title: Our 'home' in Paris; great staff, great locatin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Between visits, we look forward to our next stay at the d'Orsay and dream of their morning coffee.
reviews.title: Great location by Musee de Orsay ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's location by the Orsay and proximity to the Metro and RER stops (under the museum) are the primary reasons for staying here. All is one block away ... and the staff were extremely helpful and courteous to us. The room is roomy and nicely appointed ... with a French balcony view of the museum. However, the price seems a bit high for the value received. Other hotels in the area provide more value for the money.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Just spent one week at this hotel and was very pleased with everything. The staff was very helpful whenever we needed information about what was open or closed during the strike, the room very clean and the Manager David worked very closely with us in following up on our airport pickup and plane reservations. We couldn't have been better taken care of by the d'Orsay Hotel.
reviews.title: Wow - what a wonderful place, great location, wonderful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the last hotel of a 2 week trip with my cousin. We arrived at the hotel and were told that we were in an attic room. We'd had a terrible experience in attic rooms at a hotel in Honfleur the nights preceeding our arrival, so we asked for another room. The wonderful guy at reception assured us that we would love this room as it was an upgrade (we don't know how we received an upgrade).
reviews.title: Very Comfortable Hotel with Excellent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel d'Orsay in July and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We arrived mid morning after a sleepless flight. The hotel manager instructed the housekeeping staff to make up our room so it would be available after breakfast.
reviews.title: A pleasant stay in a charming hotel.
wonderful location
reviews.text: The entire staff was friendly, helpful and were ver accommodating about our minimal French speaking abilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Superbly situated near to the Musee d'Orsay this hotel offered clean rooms and polite and courteous staff. It was probably the most plush hotel on our 20 day tour of west Europe but it never gave the impression of being pretentious. The breakfasts were nice and there were some decently priced restaurants near the Assemblee National Metro station (60 yard walk). Our boys' room, on the sixth floor, had some steep stairs to negotiate from the 5th floor (perfectly OK for them but not recommended for the unfit).
reviews.title: Great location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was a 4 night city break with my brother and we both thought the hotel exceeded our expectations. We booked a twin room which was spacious, clean and not at all tired as prvoius reviewers had stated. The reception staff were friendly and we even had a little joke with them. Breakfast was included in our booking served in a bright airy dining room. It included fresh coffee served by the delightful waiter, fruit, a choice of breads , pastries and cheeses and breakfast cereals. We found Paris generally expensive however this hotel provided value for money in a great location. You can walk to the Musee D'Orsay and Louvre. Our room was to the front and yes there was noise from the road however if you have been sight seeing all day it does not annoy an exhausted tourist. Very clean hotel and I would definately recommed it and will return myself to it next trip tp Paris.
reviews.title: Great location, and not much else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gene and I stayed at the Hotel D'Orsay 9 nights and found it to be the perfect location for us - just off the Seine and a short walk to the great museums and gardens of Paris. Easy access to the metro and buses. The staff was courteous and helpful and the breakfast was very good and the kitchen staff excellent - happy to indulge requests as well as serve a hearty buffet. So happy we found the quiet, restful D'Orsay and look forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: Perfect Location - Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a top floor room looking out over the rooftops with a romantic Paris view and nice cross ventilation. It was the largest room we have ever had in a European hotel. The lift only went to the fifth floor, so we had to climb one, but we loved the space and privacy. Very helpful manager and staff. Breakfast was expensive, but good. As other reviews have mentioned, the location is excellent, particularly for walkers. The d'Orsay was recommended by good friends whom we sent a thank you postcard.
reviews.title: A perfect Paris stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: this not being my first trip to paris, I like to try different locations, since each neighborhood has it's own flavor. this hotel is really very well located as convenient to cafe's on St. Germain as well as transportation to anywhere in front of the Muse DOrsay a block away. it is on a quiet side street and the staff is very helpful getting you around. for the location the price was fair, the room adequate size for three, but the buffet breakfast was a disappointment- no brie in paris? I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We returned to the Hotel d' Orsay for 4 more nights in May of 2011. Requested our favorite room #17, big, quiet, comfortable bed, big bathroom, separate W C, table, chairs, two big windows. Staff is very helpful, speak English, use of Internet Computer, one block from the Musee d' Orsay. Near a subway entrance, Restaurants, bars, shopping, one block from the Seine, one block from Blvd. Saint Germain, near the Latin Quarter, just across the river to The Louvre. All of Paris within walking distance.
reviews.title: Great Hotel on the Left Bank

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Hotel typically parisian - nice reception area, rooms quite a let down. Booked a "Club Room" with courtyard view - view onto the back end of other buildings and view into their kitchen skylight. Not Impressed :(
reviews.title: Paying for the Location !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice room, 3 minutes walk from Museum d'Orsay and expensive, but delicious breakfast.
reviews.title: worth the money spent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the hotel and it was just a nice as the first. The location of the hotel is wonderful!! The rooms are clean and the staff is always helpful and pleasant.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great hotel in a PERFECT location, near to all areas and sights. Rooms are fine, breakfast was good to our surprise in France. Big bathroom, nice size room, we shared with 3 in one room. The extra bed was OK.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have no complaints about this hotel. If you plan on walking the city of Paris, this is your hotel. 3 blocks away from Musee d'Orsay, 10 mins. from the Lourve, 20 minute stroll to the Eiffel Tower and a comfortable walk to everything else in the city. There is train station on the corner and buses on the avenue behind the hotel. We had a nice breakfast there, left to sight see and returned in the evening to sleep. Our room, a queen with a 1 roll away, was clean and appropriate as was the the bathroom. When I return to Paris I will stay here again!!!
reviews.title: Perfect location for walking to EVERYTHING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this place in Paris. We managed to get a very large room for 150€ per night. A pretty good price for Paris and a central location like this one. The Musee d'Orsay was one block away, and the RER is right there, so it is very convenient.
reviews.title: Huge bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Basic is the theme here and truely the hotel is not charming. Upon arrival the desk clerk was veryy helpful and friendly, but some of the staff during the couse of our stay was not much help.
reviews.title: Basic, Basic, Basic, but good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very large by European standards,but the wallpaper peeling off the wall and lack of art or anything on the walls did not help the ambiance. The bathroom on the other hand was very large and nicely done in ceramic tile. All in all the hotel was ok if you are just looking for a place in an excellent loction.
reviews.title: Our feedback to this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: Great hotel..friendly people and really convenient location for all the sights. We hardly used public transport during our visit! We booked the suite which was large and had a quiet balcony to the back. Very romantic. Will visit again.
reviews.title: Great hotel..friendly people and really...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: location is great, staff is friendly, but the room... I booked it as a double, but it has only one bedtable(there is no space for second one), it has no drawers, not even shelves!
reviews.title: never seen double rooms like that, even in the motels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: practically no space to put suitcases on. Bathroom is the tiniest, shelf there isn't big enough even for one traveler. I guess this space (#18) never meant to be a guest room, because on both bathroom and closet are built into the room, mating it even smaller. When I complained to one of the staff, he politely told me that they are honest about the condition of the room on their website. I don't know I didn't check. Too bad I couldn't find it on tripadvisor. So, be very carefull choosing the room. Definitely, not #18
reviews.title: Dreadful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I hesitate to give a completely negative review, but considering that I chose this hotel on the basis of inexplicably positive ones on your site, I need to add a bit of realisim to the mix. That the lobby is nothing like the photos and the reception was lukewarm was not a problem for me. What was a problem was the room. On opening the door, the first thing I saw was a filthy carpet, the second was wallpaper buckling and peeling and full of stains, and the third was a can of a particularly nasty insecticide for, among other things, lice, bedbugs, fleas and mites that the maid had left out. When I pulled the sheets back there were curly black hairs between them, and when I looked at the flannel mattress pad it was literally covered in hair. I left the room without unpacking and returned the key. The woman at the front desk was angry and insisted on inspecting the room with me. She was considerably more subdued after seeing it, but did try to tell me that I shouldn't have looked at the mattress pad because it was under the sheets and didn't matter. There are a lot of other reasonably priced hotels in the neighborhood, so give this one a pass. And btw, the "view of the Musee d'Orsay" is a fiction, since it is over a block away.
reviews.title: Wonderfully surprised...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving at our hotel, we were wonderfully surprised by the location, and the beautiful room that we had. It was a nice size room, and the bathroom was extremely large and comfortable for two people. The location was close to the Musee d'Orsay (of course), and in a nice district that was quiet. There were local shops and restaurants around the corner, all within walking distance. We enjoyed our stay here immensely, and would not hesitate to go back.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night on a business trip. The hotel is nice and well located. The suites are on the top floor and are really spacious, there are some old, antique furniture in the room, which look nice but quite unusable (e.g.: wardrobe nearly impossible to close the door). Arrived really late and had a breakfast outside, so no impression on services offered, neither on breakfast. Front desk service was kind and professional, checking in and out went easy, but had some problems with my company credit card but finally solved.
reviews.title: Nice and spacious suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Was there on business. Room to the yard. No nice view of course, but quiet. Keeping the window open for sleeping was no problem. Nice bathroom for two. Be advised that if you travel with a woman, you will end up fighting for closet space. At least in room 21. Very small closet. Can confirm that staff is nice and efficient. Definitely an option for a future visit.
reviews.title: small but nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel d'Orsay for a week this past Spring (April 2011). It was our first time in Paris and we found it to be a great base to explore all the usual touristy sites. The hotel is located in a safe area and only two blocks away from the subway which takes you anywhere you want to go in the city. We had no problems walking around - day or night - and always felt safe. Very clean rooms (albeit small), but the bed was comfy. The only downside for us was the fact that they only have one iron in a room on the first floor that you have to go to each time you want to iron something (can't bring the iron up to your room). If possible, bring a small travel iron with you! I would definitely return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Great base for our first time exploring Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the bank holiday weekend. Very good location - everything walkable or metro nearby and velo station near too. Room was huge (delux room), vey quiet and nice shower/bath. This all being said I would expect this for the amount we spent but I guess you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Very nice stay - everything we wanted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is near the Musée d'Orsay, but other than that, we found little else of interest in the nearby area (neither sights, nor shopping nor eating). Close to a Metro stop that is served by only one line.
reviews.title: We had a really good room, but an otherwise average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's the location! Every evening - a walk in the Tuilierie Gardens - walk up and down the Seine to other sites. Easy metro. Hotel personnel helpful and caring when baggage missing for a couple of days. Our second stay at D'orsay in as many years. Good breakfast. The rooms are lovely - the beds comfortable - a perfect home base for us. We tend to stay about 8-9 days when we go so know the room service is prompt and professional. Check website for good deals. We call it our home in Paris.
reviews.title: Why would anyone stay anywhere else?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we travel to Paris, about three times a year, we always book a superior or deluxe room at the Hotel d'Orsay, because of :
reviews.title: Our home away from home in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * the absolutely perfect location, making it possible to walk everywhere, yet also with easy bus and metro connections and easy to find taxi service
reviews.title: Quite nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * the attractive building (right behind the socialist party headquarters, and believe me, they always choose the most luxurious!)
reviews.title: An ideal place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * elegant furnishings in the rooms, which have been renovated to top standard
reviews.title: A Great Stay!

description: The Hotel d'Orsay, housed in two beautiful XVIIIth century buildings, is close to the Orsay museum. A delightful patio, pleasant to the eyes, a large and smartly furnished lobby, warmly decorated rooms, classical or modern works of art provide a setting of refinement, comfort and serenity. In the heart of Paris and set in a quiet area, a stone's throw from the river Seine, the magnificent garden of the Tuileries (Louvre Garden), the Louvre Museum and Saint-Germain-des-Près Quarter, the Hotel d'Orsay opens its doors to Art, gardens and business.
